title: Garmin - City Navigator North America NT 2016.10 Unlocked IMG
description:
instructions for using this file on your Nav unit.
 First uncompress the file named "gmapsupp.7z" using 7zip you can 
 downloaded from http://www.7-zip.org/ only and it is FREEEEEEEE

Part A Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Internal Memory if you have more than 2.4GB free

1. Connect your device to the computer.
2. Go into the Nuvi files located in the Garmin folder and backup 
   the file named Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ to your computer.
3. Delete the Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ file from the device.
4. Rename the file you downloaded "gmapsupp.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ to Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
5. Copy the unlocked Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ file that you renamed into the device. 
   (these copy proceedures could take up to 45 minutes to accomplish)
6. Restart your device and check your map info via : Tools>Settings>Map>Map Info.
   Why the renaming?
This must be done because this is not the primary mapset as it is being used from the SD card. The primary mapset is the one on the GPSÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s internal memory.


Part B Ã¢â‚¬â€œ SD Card

1. Get a 4GB SD card (NOT SDHC for old unit) and format it FAT32

2. Create a folder on the memory card called Ã¢â‚¬Å“GarminÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½

3. Copy the downloaded Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapsupp.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ file into the Garmin folder on your SD card.

4. Insert the SD card into your Garmin GPS, and browse to your map information on your Garmin GPS and you should see the new maps selected. This can be found on the device via : Tools>Settings>Map>Map Info.

5. Deselect the mapset that's out of date.


ENJOY!
